diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: metastatic serous ovarian carcinoma, primary colon carcinoma
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's clinical presentation of rectal bleeding and altered bowel habits suggested colorectal cancer; however, the biopsy showed poorly differentiated invasive adenocarcinoma with atypical mitotic activity. Immunohistochemistry raised the possibility of a gynaecological cancer, leading to the diagnosis of primary peritoneal serous adenocarcinoma after pathological review and additional surgical findings.
